comment: Yaps way too much and is hard to understand. He says “are you with me?” After every sentence and nobody is “with him.” Easy A but don't take if you want to learn something. Takes attendance.

He is very difficult to hear/understand, he is condescending in his communication with students, and is beyond unorganized. He never has any clear instructions or grading criteria, and while he does respond to emails quickly, they are often of little help. Quizzes are graded subjectively and with no explanation. Truly awful in every way.

I did not get as much out of senior project as I could. To me, class is dis-organized in D2L everything from numerous semesters put in at once. I got the feeling he did not put in as much work as he could for this very important class, who knows he could be behind the scenes doing stuff, but I doubt it. Going to class was a waste.

Dr. Okhio is a bit of a strange man in his teaching practices. Lecture will be straight from the slides with a tiny bit of outside material. The textbook is horrid and is a chopped up version of another book. He will tell you in the beginning that "my A's sit up front". Do so, make sure he knows your name, and do well on the project. Guaranteed A/B

He leaves things very opened in this class. test are HARD. I got a 32 on the first exam and I studied hard for that that test, but he curves. i ended up with an A in the class with the final group project. That project is LIFE OR DEATH, BRAVE OR GRAVE. make sure he know your name in this class and READ THE TEXT! but his is a cool guy none the less.

Cool guy, but not the best professor. I've had him for two classes, and I do not like his teaching style, which seems to be the census I gather from others as well. He makes tests really hard. It is ESSENTIAL that you put forth effort and sit in the front. Very political when it comes down to final grades. Gives a group project every semester.

Overall, his teaching was not helpful. You will be reading a lot of the textbook to figure out yourself what is going on. His tests come from the textbook, but he just does not teach anything. His favorite quote "it is not rocket science." Trust me, nothing good comes from this class.

Engineering calculations was probably the hardest most demeaning class I have ever taken. Not just due to the material, but the way he teaches. He expected everyone to know Diff EQ and Fluid dynamics, which aren't prerequisites. Didn't learn much from class, but made a B. Do well on the project, speak up in class, and put forth effort.

He is a cool guy, but not the best professor. Tests are really hard, so the class averages are pretty low. If you make a 60, then you're doing well. It's not a big deal, he does a curve at the end. He always assigns a big project in his classes and that's a bigger factor for your grade. Make sure you speak up in class, and that he knows your name.
free a+ if you take this. dont worry, youll pay later for not having been taught.

Really easy because he wont teach you or test you on anything really signifagant.  We had 4 test; two were group tests, 1 take home, and I didnt have to take the final.  He rambles alot and his accent is somtimes hard to understand.  He really makes you feel inferior and talks up how much better education is in the UK.

This is by far one of the best professors at the university.  I would say this is one of maybe two professors that I've had who apply "REAL WORLD" situations versus flipping pages through a book and spitting out numbers.  You do need to attend class, and you do need to pay attention.  The rest is a breeze.
really nice guy, did I learn anything? not really. at least I picked up a few basics but still feel completely lost. Easy to get a good grade but plan on being confused a lot.
